authors: Frank W. Moler, M.D, M.S, University of Michigan
citation.title: Therapeutic Hypothermia to Improve Survival After Cardiac Arrest in Pediatric Patients-THAPCA-IH [In Hospital] Trial

blogs.title: Two treatments yield similar results for children after cardiac arrest
blogs.summary: A large-scale, multicenter study has shown that emergency body cooling does not improve survival rates or reduce brain injury in infants and children with out-of-hospital cardiac arrest more than normal temperature control.

author.name: U-M Health News
author.description: University of Michigan Health System is the #1 hospital in Michigan and metro Detroit and nationally ranked in 22 children’s and adult specialties.

news.title: Two treatments yield similar results for children after cardiac arrest
news.summary: A large-scale, multicenter study has shown that emergency body cooling does not improve survival rates or reduce brain injury in infants and children with out-of-hospital cardiac arrest more than normal temperature control.

news.title: Therapeutic Hypothermia after In-Hospital Cardiac Arrest in Children
news.summary: Editor's Note: The narration and closed captions in this video are in English. For subtitles in 13 other languages, see this video on the website of the World Health Organization.

author.name: The New England Journal of Medicine

news.title: Cooling No Help after Cardiac Arrest in Kids
news.summary: HONOLULU -- Therapeutic hypothermia failed to improve survival in children resuscitated from in-hospital cardiac arrest, results of a large randomized trial showed.
